thread.title: Mets' Steven Matz making his pitch to be on playoff roster
thread.title_full: Mets' Steven Matz making his pitch to be on playoff roster

title: Mets' Steven Matz making his pitch to be on playoff roster
text:
Mets' Steven Matz making his pitch to be on playoff roster October 8, 2015, 2:21 PM Last updated: Thursday, October 8, 2015, 2:36 PM By MATT EHALT Print 
Mets starter Steven Matz, who has been hampered by a back issue, threw approximately 90 pitches in a simulated game Thursday morning at the team's complex in Port St. Lucie, Fla. 
He could be in line to start Tuesday's Game 4 of the National League Division Series against the Dodgers at Citi Field. 
General manager Sandy Alderson said the team would see how Matz performed in his outing and how he felt afterward before making any determinations as rosters for the division series are due Friday. 
The team could always place Matz on the roster and determine whether they want to use him as a starter or a reliever. 
If Matz is not able to start Game 4, it would go to either Bartolo Colon or Jacob deGrom, who would be pitching on short rest. Â© 2015
